ETYMOLOGY: Contraction of 'mistress', used since the 17th century to denote a married woman or the female head of a household. The contraction maintains the pronunciation of 'missus'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: title: A word used before a person's name to indicate status or respect.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A title or courtesy title used before the surname or full name of a married woman.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于已婚女性姓氏或全名之前的称谓或敬称。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Mrs. Henderson has lived next door for thirty years.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 亨德森夫人已经在隔壁住了三十年了。
